description: Supporting Nigeria's Capacity for Governance  and Conflict Prevention, Management and Peace-Building at the Federal and State level.

subproject.description: The purpose of the Initiation Plan (IP) is to: (a) prepare a programme/project document on support to democratic governance for development which can be supported by CIDA, DFID, EC and UNDP; (b) establish a core project management and coordination structure; and (c) undertake a limited launch of a set of activities for further analysis and planning as well as implementation of a number of priority actions, including testing of interventions strategies.  The  implementation will be executed by UNDP though the Direct Implementation Modality (DIM).
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Deepening Democracy in Nigeria

subproject.description:
This project aims to support the Anticorruption and procurement  reform process in Nigeria. The focus areas include:
(1) Further integrating anti-corruption measures and procurement reforms into public sector management. 
(2) Strengthening citizen voice and action in the fight for improved public integrity 
(3) To strengthen more transparent monitoring of government operations for public integrity through better management of public information.
subproject.title: Federal Public Accountability

Focus areas:

subproject.description: Plans, mechanisms and actions developed with key stakeholders in the North-Central States and other relevant parts of Nigeria to prevent, manage and resolve conflict and  respond to emergency or disaster situations resulting from violent conflicts.
subproject.title: Niger Delta Improved Governanc

subproject.description: Plans, mechanisms and actions developed with key stakeholders in the North-Central States and other relevant parts of Nigeria to prevent, manage and resolve conflict and  respond to emergency or disaster situations resulting from violent conflicts.
subproject.title: Niger Delta Improved Governanc

subproject.description:
This project is a component of the partner support  to the medium  and long-term development  for the Niger Delta area located in the South south region of Nigeria, and the North Central area . The major output  include plans, mechanisms and actions developed with key stakeholders in the North-Central States and other relevant parts of Nigeria to prevent, manage and resolve conflict and  respond to emergency or disaster situations resulting from violent conflicts and other natural disasters. 
Key strategies include supporting the system to idenitfy pro-poor approaches to improving livelihoods as a means of conflict prevention, and supporting community engagement and policy dialouge.
subproject.title: Conflict Mgt. & Prevention

subproject.description:
(i)	An inventory of existing governance indicators and the associated information base in Nigeria in place.
(ii)	A framework for assessment of urban governance exists in Nigeria, including identification of appropriate indicators, methodologies and sources.
(iii)	Reliable data on urban governance assessment for a sample of small, medium and large urban cities exists in Nigeria.
(iv)	‘Urban Governance Information Resource Centres’ sited in each of the 8 cities and FCT.
(v)	One or more major policy advocacy initiatives aimed at reaching key target groups developed
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Good Urban Governance

subproject.description:
The Niger Delta area is located in the South-South region in Nigeria. It consists of several oil producing states. The project focuses on  local government areas in the Niger-Delta.  The main objective of the project  is to support the development of effective, responsive and accountable local governance institutions capable of delivering public infrastructure and services using participatory transparent and gender sensitive planning monitoring and evaluation procedures.
Key Strategies include suppoert and participation in policy review processes, community engagement and support to institutional building.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Niger Delta Local Dev. Program

subproject.title: Niger Delta Local Dev. Program

subproject.description:
It aims to strengthen and develop tools and mechanisms that would ensure communities' voice is part of decision-making , community influences the outcome of development projects and also improve responsiveness of local government authorities to community demand. To be piloted in 21 LGAs, across the six geo-political zones of Nigeria and anchoed on the Conditional Grants Scheme (CGS) LGA track - the project would improve the capacity of Community Based Organisations (CBOs), to appropriately focus development interventions; develop a community participation protocol and most importantly institutionalise a feed-back and dialogue mechanism between rights holders and duty bearers in participating LGAs. 

,
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Enhancing Citizen Engagement

title: Capacity for Governance Programme & Conflict Management
